summary: The American Entrepreneurs First Act mandates that applicants for certain Small Business Administration loans provide documentation regarding their citizenship status. This includes date of birth, certification of US citizenship, national status, or lawful permanent residency for individual applicants and beneficial owners of applicant concerns. The bill also prohibits loan approval for applicants failing to provide this information or who have ineligible owners, defining "ineligible person" as asylees, refugees, visa holders, nonimmigrants, DACA recipients, or those without lawful immigration status.
